1.brief: properly, like this, i.e. by implication, (of manner) thus (or so); also (of place) here (or hither); or (of time) now
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
a bird-trap (as furnished with a clap-stick or treadle to spring it); hence, a basket (as resembling a wicker cage)
harvest (as the crop), whether the product (grain or fruit) or the (dry) season

2.brief: to say (used with great latitude)

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you

Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to add or augment (often adverbial, to continue to do a thing)
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)

3.brief: to howl (with a wailing tone) or yell (with a boisterous one)
a large public building, such as a palace or temple
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
a carcase (as limp), whether of man or beast; figuratively, an idolatrous image
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

to throw out, down or away (literally or figuratively)

4.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
to inhale eagerly; figuratively, to cover; by implication, to be angry; also to hasten
to repose, i.e. desist from exertion; used in many implied relations (causative, figurative or specific)
depressed (figuratively), in mind (gentle) or circumstances (needy, especially saintly)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

5.brief: properly, extent (of time); but used only adverbially (especially with other particle prefixes), when (either relative or interrogative)
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
the new moon; by implication, a month
to open wide (literally or figuratively); specifically, to loosen, begin, plough, carve
grain of any kind (even while standing in the field); by extension the open country
to diminish, i.e. be (causatively, make) diminutive or (figuratively) of no account
an ephah or measure for grain; hence, a measure in general
to be (causatively make) large (in various senses, as in body, mind, estate or honor, also in pride)
probably a weight; used as a commercial standard
(only in the dual) a pair of scales

6.brief: to erect, i.e. create; by extension, to procure, especially by purchase (causatively, sell); by implication to own
silver (from its pale color); by implication, money
properly, dangling, i.e. (by implication) weak or thin
properly, crossed, i.e. (abstractly) transit; used only adverbially, on account of, in order that

a falling off, i.e. chaff; also something pendulous, i.e. a flap
grain of any kind (even while standing in the field); by extension the open country

Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
